body: Sometimes people can say that capitalism only benefits the rich. But I personally disagree as capitalism+hard work has been a great benefit for my family and allowed us freedom when it comes to work and whatnot.
body_html: Sometimes people can say that capitalism only benefits the rich. But I personally disagree as capitalism+hard work has been a great benefit for my family and allowed us freedom when it comes to work and whatnot.
title: What are some great things about capitalism even if you aren't wealthy?

body: It allows you to see who the lazy fucks are and who the people who aren't afraid to work are.
body_html: It allows you to see who the lazy fucks are and who the people who aren't afraid to work are.

post.body_html: Sometimes people can say that capitalism only benefits the rich. But I personally disagree as capitalism+hard work has been a great benefit for my family and allowed us freedom when it comes to work and whatnot.
post.title: What are some great things about capitalism even if you aren't wealthy?

body: Capitalism is the reason 1st World Countries are 1st World Countries. Yes there are terrible things about it, but it's competitive nature allows things that make life better, to be less expensive, with numerous options, and enables charities to aid others.
body_html: Capitalism is the reason 1st World Countries are 1st World Countries. Yes there are terrible things about it, but it's competitive nature allows things that make life better, to be less expensive, with numerous options, and enables charities to aid others.

post.body: Sometimes people can say that capitalism only benefits the rich. But I personally disagree as capitalism+hard work has been a great benefit for my family and allowed us freedom when it comes to work and whatnot.
post.body_html: Sometimes people can say that capitalism only benefits the rich. But I personally disagree as capitalism+hard work has been a great benefit for my family and allowed us freedom when it comes to work and whatnot.
post.title: What are some great things about capitalism even if you aren't wealthy?

body:
Allegedly even rose the standard of living for the poor as well: https://fee.org/articles/capitalism-is-good-for-the-poor/

I mean even in first world ghettos people sometimes drive nice cars and have fancy tech and things

Addendum:

> For example, the percentage of American households below the poverty line who have basic appliances has grown steadily over the last few decades, with poor families in 2005 being more likely to own things like a clothes dryer, dishwasher, refrigerator, or air conditioner than the average household was in 1971. And consumer items that didn’t even exist back then, such as cell phones, were owned by half of poor households in 2005 and are owned by a substantial majority of them today.
body_html:
Allegedly even rose the standard of living for the poor as well: https://fee.org/articles/capitalism-is-good-for-the-poor/

I mean even in first world ghettos people sometimes drive nice cars and have fancy tech and things

Addendum:

For example, the percentage of American households below the poverty line who have basic appliances has grown steadily over the last few decades, with poor families in 2005 being more likely to own things like a clothes dryer, dishwasher, refrigerator, or air conditioner than the average household was in 1971. And consumer items that didn’t even exist back then, such as cell phones, were owned by half of poor households in 2005 and are owned by a substantial majority of them today.

author.bio: I'm a writer who does stuff and also plays Elder Scrolls and Dark Souls and the like.
author.bio_html: I'm a writer who does stuff and also plays Elder Scrolls and Dark Souls and the like.

body:
You can become wealthy if you're not already, and even if you don't you still have basically the highest standard of living out of anywhere at any point in human history.

Economic mobility is practically unheard of otherwise.
body_html:
You can become wealthy if you're not already, and even if you don't you still have basically the highest standard of living out of anywhere at any point in human history.

Economic mobility is practically unheard of otherwise.

post.title: What are some great things about capitalism even if you aren't wealthy?

body: Rich people pay others to do the easiest, most trivial things. I once got a day's work sticking price labels on cups, purely because the department store had better things to do. Rich people also generate a tonne of waste that poor people can consume. One of my flatmates worked in the kitchen at a posh club, ate leftover food he could have never afforded.
body_html: Rich people pay others to do the easiest, most trivial things. I once got a day's work sticking price labels on cups, purely because the department store had better things to do. Rich people also generate a tonne of waste that poor people can consume. One of my flatmates worked in the kitchen at a posh club, ate leftover food he could have never afforded.

post.title: What are some great things about capitalism even if you aren't wealthy?

author.bio: Unironic Anarcho-Monarchist. I also collect stamps.

body:
Whenever there is a voluntary exchange between two parties, both are better off than before. Otherwise, none of the parties would have made the exchange in the first place. This is the basic tenet of Capitalism. Theoretically, every single voluntary transaction and trade improve the lives of everybody and therefore of society as a whole. 

Under pure Capitalism, the rich get richer, and the poor ... also get richer. 

Problems arise when you introduce involuntary exchanges and transactions, like taxes or other government mandates.
body_html:
Whenever there is a voluntary exchange between two parties, both are better off than before. Otherwise, none of the parties would have made the exchange in the first place. This is the basic tenet of Capitalism. Theoretically, every single voluntary transaction and trade improve the lives of everybody and therefore of society as a whole.

Under pure Capitalism, the rich get richer, and the poor ... also get richer.

Problems arise when you introduce involuntary exchanges and transactions, like taxes or other government mandates.

body: It helps you know you're not the problem which helps your self esteem a little, but it being the outside world also means you can't do anything about it and probably won't find a solution. For example I wasn't born with the genes necessary for the life I want, I'm slowly understanding it's not my fault, but I can never hope to change it.

post.body_html: Sometimes people can say that capitalism only benefits the rich. But I personally disagree as capitalism+hard work has been a great benefit for my family and allowed us freedom when it comes to work and whatnot.
post.title: What are some great things about capitalism even if you aren't wealthy?
